column1: #Text=The employee is subject to a Federal quarantine order related to COVID-19.
#Text=The employee is subject to a Federal isolation order related to COVID-19.
#Text=The employee is subject to a State quarantine order related to COVID-19.
#Text=The employee is subject to a State isolation order related to COVID-19.
#Text=The employee is subject to a local quarantine order related to COVID-19.
#Text=The employee is subject to a local isolation order related to COVID-19.
#Text=An employee who is a health care provider.
#Text=An employee who is an emergency responder
#Text=An employee shall be entitled to paid sick time for an amount of hours determined under [statement 4].
#Text=The amount of hours of paid sick time to which a full-time employees are entitled shall be 80 hours.

#Text=The amount of hours of paid sick time to which a part-time employees are entitled shall be a number of hours equal to the number of hours that such employee works, on average, over a 2-week period.
#Text=Paid sick time under this section shall not carry over from 1 year to the next
#Text=Paid sick time provided to an employee under this Act shall cease beginning with the employee's next scheduled workshift.
#Text=Paid sick time provided to an employee under this Act shall cease immediately following the termination of the need for paid sick time under subsection (a).

#Text=The paid sick time under subsection (a) shall be available for immediate use by the employee for the purposes described in such subsection, regardless of how long the employee has been employed by an employer.
#Text=An employee may first use the paid sick time under subsection (a) for the purposes described in such subsection.
#Text=An employer who violates section 5102 shall be considered to have failed to pay minimum wages in violation of section 6 of the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 (29 U.S.C. 206).
#Text=An employer who violates section 5102 shall be subject to the penalties described in sections 16 and 17 of such Act (29 U.S.C. 216; 217) with respect to such violation.
#Text=Nothing in this Act shall be construed to in any way diminish the rights that an employee is entitled to under any other Federal law.
#Text=Nothing in this Act shall be construed to in any way diminish the benefits that an employee is entitled to under any other Federal law.
#Text=Nothing in this Act shall be construed to in any way diminish the rights that an employee is entitled to under any other State.
#Text=Nothing in this Act shall be construed to in any way diminish the benefits that an employee is entitled to under any other State.
#Text=Nothing in this Act shall be construed to in any way diminish the rights that an employee is entitled to under any local law.
#Text=Nothing in this Act shall be construed to in any way diminish the benefits that an employee is entitled to under any local law.
#Text=Nothing in this Act shall be construed to in any way diminish the rights that an employee is entitled to under any collective bargaining agreement.
#Text=Nothing in this Act shall be construed to in any way diminish the benefits that an employee is entitled to under any collective bargaining agreement.
#Text=Nothing in this Act shall be construed to in any way diminish the rights that an employee is entitled to under any existing employer policy.
#Text=Nothing in this Act shall be construed to in any way diminish the benefits that an employee is entitled to under any existing employer policy.

#Text=Nothing in this Act shall be construed to require financial reimbursement to an employee from an employer upon the employee's termination from employment for paid sick time under this Act that has not been used by such employee.

#Text=Nothing in this Act shall be construed to require financial reimbursement to an employee from an employer upon the employee's resignation from employment for paid sick time under this Act that has not been used by such employee.

#Text=Nothing in this Act shall be construed to require financial reimbursement to an employee from an employer upon the employee's retirement from employment for paid sick time under this Act that has not been used by such employee.

#Text=Nothing in this Act shall be construed to require financial reimbursement to an employee from an employer upon the employee's other separation from employment for paid sick time under this Act that has not been used by such employee.

#Text=Nothing in this Act shall be construed to require other reimbursement to an employee from an employer upon the employee's termination from employment for paid sick time under this Act that has not been used by such employee.

#Text=Nothing in this Act shall be construed to require other reimbursement to an employee from an employer upon the employee' resignation from employment for paid sick time under this Act that has not been used by such employee.

#Text=Nothing in this Act shall be construed to require other reimbursement to an employee from an employer upon the employee's retirement from employment for paid sick time under this Act that has not been used by such employee.

#Text=Nothing in this Act shall be construed to require other reimbursement to an employee from an employer upon the employee's other separation from employment for paid sick time under this Act that has not been used by such employee.
#Text=This Act shall take effect not later than 15 days after the date of enactment of this Act.
#Text=The requirements under this Act shall take effect not later than 15 days after the date of enactment of this Act.
#Text=The requirements under this Act, shall expire on December 31, 2020.

#Text=[Individual] is an employee, as defined in section 3(e) of the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 (29 U.S.C. 203(e)), except that a reference in such section to an employer shall be considered to be a reference to an employer described in clauses (i)(I) and (ii) of paragraph (5)(A).
#Text=[Individual] is not covered under subparagraph (E)including such an employee of the Library of Congress.
#Text=[Individual] is not covered under subparagraph(F) including such an employee of the Library of Congress.
#Text=[Individual] [is] employee of the Government Accountability Office.
#Text=[Individual] is a State employee described in section 304(a) of the Government Employee Rights Act of 1991 (42 U.S.C. 2000e-16c(a)).
#Text=[Individual] is a State employee described in section 304(a) of the Government Employee Rights Act of 1991 (42 U.S.C. 2000e-16c(a)).
#Text=[Individual] is covered employee, as defined in section 101 of the Congressional Accountability Act of 1995 (2 U.S.C. 1301), other than an applicant for employment.
#Text=[Individual] is a covered employee, as defined in section 411(c) of title 3, United States Code.
#Text=[Individual] is a Federal officer covered under subchapter V of chapter 63 of title 5, United States Code.
#Text=[Individual] is a employee covered under subchapter V of chapter 63 of title 5, United States Code.
#Text=[Individual] is any other individual occupying a position in the civil service (as that term is defined in section 2101(1) of title 5, United States Code).
#Text=A person is a covered employer, as defined in subparagraph (B), who is not covered under subclause (V).
#Text=A person is an entity employing a State employee described in section 304(a) of the Government Employee Rights Act of 1991.
#Text=A person is an employing office, as defined in section 101 of the Congressional Accountability Act of 1995.
#Text=A person is an employing office as defined in section 411(c) of title 3, United States Code.
#Text=A person is an Executive Agency as defined in section 105 of title 5, United States Code, and including the U.S. Postal Service and the Postal Regulatory Commission.
#Text=A person is engaged in commerce (including government).
#Text=A person is engaged in an industry.
#Text=A person is engaged in activity affecting commerce (including government), as defined in subparagraph (B)(iii).
#Text=Any person engaged in commerce that in the case of a private entity, employs fewer than 500 employees.
#Text=Any person engaged in commerce that in the case of a individual entity, employs fewer than 500 employees.
#Text=Any person engaged in commerce that in the case of a public agency employs 1 or more  employees.
#Text=Any person engaged in commerce that in the case of any other entity that is not a private entity or individual, employs 1 or more  employees.
#Text=Any person engaged in any industry that in the case of a private entity, employs fewer than 500 employees.
#Text=Any person engaged in any industry that in the case of a individual entity, employs fewer than 500 employees.
#Text=Any person engaged in any industry that in the case of a public agency employs 1 or more  employees.
#Text=Any person engaged in any industry that in the case of any other entity that is not a private entity or individual, employs 1 or more  employees.
#Text=Any person engaged activity affecting commerce that in the case of a private entity employs fewer than 500 employees.
#Text=Any person engaged activity affecting commerce that in the case of a individual entity employs fewer than 500 employees.
#Text=Any person engaged activity affecting commerce that in the case of a public agency employs 1 or more  employees.
#Text=Any person engaged activity affecting commerce that in the case any other entity that is not a private entity or individual, employs 1 or more  employees.
#Text=In subparagraph (A)(i)(I), the term ``covered employer'' includes any successor in  interest of an employer.
#Text=In subparagraph (A)(i)(I), the term ``covered employer'' includes any ``public agency'', as defined in section 3(x) of  the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 (29  U.S.C. 203(x)).
#Text=In subparagraph (A)(i)(I), the term ``covered employer'' includes the Government Accountability Office.
#Text=In subparagraph (A)(i)(I), the term ``covered employer'' includes the Library of Congress.
#Text=For purposes of clause (i)(IV), a public agency shall be considered to be a person engaged in commerce.
#Text=For purposes of clause (i)(IV), a public agency shall be considered to be a person engaged in an industry.
#Text=For purposes of clause (i)(IV), a public agency shall be considered to be a person engaged in an activity affecting commerce.
#Text=For purposes of this subparagraph the term ``commerce'' means any activity in commerce.
#Text=For purposes of this subparagraph the terms ``commerce'' means any activity in which a labor dispute would hinder commerce or the free flow of commerce.
#Text=For purposes of this subparagraph the terms ``commerce'' means any activity in which a labor dispute would obstruct commerce or the free flow of commerce.
#Text=For purposes of this subparagraph the terms ``commerce'' means any business in commerce.
#Text=For purposes of this subparagraph the terms ``commerce'' means any business in which a labor dispute would hinder commerce or the free flow of commerce.
#Text=For purposes of this subparagraph the terms ``commerce'' means any business in which a labor dispute would obstruct commerce or the free flow of commerce.
#Text=For purposes of this subparagraph the terms ``commerce'' means any industry in commerce.
#Text=For purposes of this subparagraph the terms ``commerce'' means any industry in which a labor dispute would hinder commerce or the free flow of commerce.
#Text=For purposes of this subparagraph the terms ``commerce'' means any industry in which a labor dispute would obstruct commerce or the free flow of commerce.
#Text=For purposes of this subparagraph the terms ``industry or activity affecting commerce'' means any activity in commerce.
#Text=For purposes of this subparagraph the terms ``industry or activity affecting commerce'' means any activity in which a labor dispute would hinder commerce or the free flow of commerce.

#Text=For purposes of this subparagraph the terms ``industry or activity affecting commerce'' means any activity in commerce or in which a labor dispute would obstruct commerce or the free flow of commerce.
#Text=For purposes of this subparagraph the terms ``industry or activity affecting commerce'' means any business in commerce.
#Text=For purposes of this subparagraph the terms ``industry or activity affecting commerce'' means any business in which a labor dispute would hinder commerce or the free flow of commerce.

#Text=For purposes of this subparagraph the terms ``industry or activity affecting commerce'' means any business in commerce or in which a labor dispute would obstruct commerce or the free flow of commerce.
#Text=For purposes of this subparagraph the terms ``industry or activity affecting commerce'' means any industry in commerce.

#Text=For purposes of this subparagraph the terms ``industry or activity affecting commerce'' means any industry in commerce or in which a labor dispute would hinder commerce or the free flow of commerce.

#Text=For purposes of this subparagraph the terms ``industry or activity affecting commerce'' means any industry in commerce or in which a labor dispute would obstruct commerce or the free flow of commerce.

#Text=For purposes of this subparagraph the term ``commerce'' include ``commerce'' as defined in paragraphs (1) and (3) of section 501 of the Labor Management Relations Act of 1947 (29 U.S.C. 142 (1) and (3)).

#Text=For purposes of this subparagraph the terms ``industry or activity affecting commerce'' include any ``industry affecting commerce'' as defined in paragraphs (1) and (3) of section 501 of the Labor Management Relations Act of 1947 (29 U.S.C. 142 (1) and (3)).
#Text=For purposes of this subparagraph the term ``employee'' has the same meaning given such term in section 3(e) of the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 (29 U.S.C. 203(e)).
#Text=For purposes of this subparagraph the term ``person'' has the same meaning given such term in section 3(a) of the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 (29 U.S.C. 203(a)).
#Text=The term ``employ'' has the meanings given such terms in section 3 of the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 (29 U.S.C. 203).
#Text=The term ``State'' has the meanings given such terms in section 3 of the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 (29 U.S.C. 203).
#Text=The term ``health care provider'' has the meanings given such terms in section 101 of the Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993 (29 U.S.C. 2611).
#Text=The terms ``son or daughter'' has the meanings given such terms in section 101 of the Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993 (29 U.S.C. 2611).

#Text=The term ``paid sick time'' means an increment of compensated leave that--(i) is provided by an employer for use during an absence from employment for a reason described in any paragraph of section 2(a); and (ii) is calculated based on the employee's required compensation under subparagraph (B) and the number of hours the employee would otherwise be normally scheduled to work (or the number of hours calculated under subparagraph (C)), except that in no event shall such paid sick time exceed-- (I) $511 per day and $5,110 in the aggregate for a use described in paragraph (1), (2), or (3) of section 5102(a); and (II) $200 per day and $2,000 in the aggregate for a use described in paragraph (4), (5), or (6) of section 5102(a).

#Text=Subject to subparagraph (A)(ii), the employee's required compensation under this subparagraph shall be not less than the greater of the following: (I) The employee's regular rate of pay (as determined under section 7(e) of the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 (29 U.S.C. 207(e)).

#Text=Subject to subparagraph (A)(ii), the employee's required compensation under this subparagraph shall be not less than the greater of the following: (II) The minimum wage rate in effect under section 6(a)(1) of the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 (29 U.S.C. 206(a)(1)).

#Text=Subject to subparagraph (A)(ii), the employee's required compensation under this subparagraph shall be not less than the greater of the following: (III) The minimum wage rate in effect for such employee in the applicable State or locality, whichever is greater, in which the employee is employed.

#Text=Subject to subparagraph (A)(ii), with respect to any paid sick time provided for any use described in paragraph (4), (5), or (6) of section 5102(a), the employee's required compensation under this subparagraph shall be two-thirds of the amount described in clause (B)(i).
#Text=The Secretary of Labor shall have the authority to issue regulations for good cause under sections 553(b)(B) and 553(d)(A) of title 5, United States Code.
